parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post contains a CMF number (CMF 11240015) at the end. This strongly suggests electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are used for tracking campaign finance and are mandated for candidates.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions Brian Cristian, who is a candidate for the Chamber of Deputies for USR Maramureș.  The image also clearly shows him and his party affiliation. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, targeting a wide audience within Maramureș County, based on the insights data. This clearly addresses the wide population, fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to encourage voters to support Brian Cristian in the upcoming parliamentary elections.  Phrases like "Votați reprezentanți care muncesc pentru voi," "Candidez pentru un nou mandat," and "Vă îndemn să mă susțineți" explicitly aim to influence the vote. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>While the post presents some factual information (attendance record), it's primarily framed as campaign material, not objective journalism. The inclusion of subjective statements ("oameni implicați, nu doar figuri pe hârtie," "Parlament curat, fără extremiști") and a clear call to action ("Nu uitați: fiecare vot contează!") disqualifies it from being considered journalistic in nature.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post goes beyond expressing a personal opinion; it actively promotes a candidate and solicits votes.  The mention of other candidates (Elena Lasconi) is used to further bolster the case for voting for Brian Cristian.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>786314463636029</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a specific candidate (Brian Cristian), targets a wide audience through a paid Facebook advertisement, has a clear electoral objective (to increase votes for Brian Cristian), and does not adhere to journalistic standards. The presence of a CMF number further strengthens this conclusion. The post's timing (after the official campaign period) is also a significant factor.  The mention of other candidates is used to indirectly influence the vote.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Brian Cristian</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>USR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
USR Maramureș, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 786314463636029) cu conținut electoral, care promovează candidatura lui Brian Cristian pentru Camera Deputaților, folosind un limbaj persuasiv ("Votați reprezentanți care muncesc pentru voi", "Vă îndemn să mă susțineți"),  prezentând informații parțiale și subiective, și având ca efect electoral creșterea numărului de voturi pentru candidatul menționat.  Prezența numărului CMF 11240015 confirmă natura electorală a postării, iar aceasta încalcă legea prin continuarea propagandei electorale după încheierea perioadei legale.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
